author: rhuijben
msg: * context.c
(serf_context_run): For now assume that callers use APR_STATUS_IS_TIMEUP()
to detect if the loop timed out, like Subversion has for years.

author: rhuijben
msg: * serf.h
Fix serf version number, that was accidentally changed in r2184.

author: rhuijben
msg: Following up on r2183, add a new error code to also allow detecting timed out
connections on platforms where APR_TIMEUP is the system error code.
* context.c
(serf_context_run): Wrap the APR_TIMEUP error when it is used as a return
value of the event handling.
* serf.h
(SERF_ERROR_CONNECTION_TIMEDOUT): New error code.

author: rhuijben
msg: * context.c
(serf_context_run): Return the explicitly documented error on timeouts
instead of just any error that APR documents as being timeup. On Windows
this allows seeing the difference between a timed out connection (reported
as error via the poll) and no events within the timespan.
Note from Bert: this patch accidently contains a new error code description
which should have been part of r2184 instead.

author: lgo
msg: On the 1.3.x branch:
Merge build system fixes from trunk:
r2155: Fix build when GSSAPI not in default include path
r2156: OpenBSD specific: Always map all LIBPATH entries into RPATH,
not just for Solaris.
r2161: Mac OSX specific: Use major version only in the install name of
the shared library
r2162: Enable checksum generation in Windows shared libraries for
release builds.
r2163: Use for the shared library version string both MAJOR and MINOR version.
